page.title: 19Bristol's Science/Technology
page.content: Because our 12km square is based on the centre of a city, Science and Technology is very well represented. Bristol University has developed many new ideas in the science field and a great deal of research is carried on in the fields of Chemistry, Physics and Natural Sciences. The Bristol Royal Infirmary has many very modern machines used daily for diagnosis, medication and research. Schools in the area use computers. Many of the large department stores in our area use modern technology to record sales, to keep stock records and also for deliveries. The Central Police Station (The Bridewell) uses technology to control crime in the central area and to make sure the inner city traffic flows smoothly.
